Science philosophy & knowledge development

區辨及探討科學哲學的演進與知識建構之型式，科學的哲理、批判理論以及探討及評值
概念的建構及理論的發展。透過相互的研討，期能使護理博士學生能從科學哲學與知識
認識層面，探討其所關注的護理議題，且應用理論或概念建構發展與實務議題有關之護
理理論或概念模式。
This course aims to provide students with the skills to investigate, assess, and analyze
nursing knowledge. The learning experience involves the exploration of the development of
science philosophy and of nursing knowledge. The course is a research and discussion
experience aimed at enabling doctoral graduate students to become knowledgeable about
approaches to studies of scientific knowledge development. Forces affecting the development
of knowledge, the origins of key terms and concepts, and the identification of nursing issues related to epistemology and the philosophy of science identification will also be explored.

01
Doctoral  Seminar  in  Nursing  Science
本博士班專論課程旨在深入的探討護理實務與研究之議題。應用護理措
施以減輕個案因健康問題在生理、心理、社會、靈性上產生的負擔，以增進
護理實務和個案生活品質。教授和學生探討當代實務、教育和研究議題，探
索理論背景並考慮如何適當的科學研究。學生選擇議題，如疾病預防措施、
症狀管理處置、生理/心理/認知失調護理等，進行研究相關之瞭解。本課程之
另一目的是引領學生進入學術領域，如學術寫作、作者與發表倫理、學術報
告與發表、研究倫理、研究對象等。學生將選擇有興趣之議題作深入探討與
批判並撰寫成學術文章。
This doctoral seminar will provide an overview of science and research in 
nursing practice. Topics will include the patterns of human responses to illness (e.g., 
physical, functional, cognitive, psychosocial, and spiritual). In  particular, nursing 
interventions will be examined for their ability to reduce illness burden, improve care 
delivery, and enhance quality of life. Faculty and students will discuss current 
research agendas in nursing and related fields; and explore the competing theoretical 
perspectives in a substantive research area and consider how each would guide an 
empirical study. The student will select a mentor for research experiences on an issue 
topic such as prevention, symptom management, physical/mental disability and 
function, sleep and related nursing interventions. In addition, this doctoral seminar 
aims to prepare the student for scholarship careers in nursing,  including topics for 
discussion such as scientific writing, authorship and publication issues, oral 
presentation of research results, research ethics, human subject issues, and mentored 
research experiences. The student writes a synthesis of research literature, including a critical review of research in area of dissertation interest in a manuscript format to be 
submitted for publication.
全18週

The learning experience involves the exploration of the development of science philosophy and of nursing knowledge. The course is a research and discussion experience aimed at enabling doctoral graduate students to become knowledgeable about approaches to studies of scientific knowledge development. Forces affecting the development of knowledge, the origins of key terms and concepts, and the identification of nursing issues related to epistemology and the philosophy of science identification will also be explored.

本課程在提供學生對環境與健康政策的整體觀，從預防保健的角度分析國內及國際的環境與健康政策議題，並重新定位健康與環境政策原則。學生可針對各國健康政策的推動、健康服務品質的保障、國內外政府與非政府之健康組織與資源的整合與運用等議題進行分析與討論，針對上述健康政策議題提出需求評估、計畫評值或成果評價。

Students critique and debate a variety of health care reforms to enhance quality, assure access, and improve cost efficiency. The application of nursing research in outcome studies, program evaluation, and needs assessment is explored.

本課程著眼於博士層級之量性資料分析理論與實務。主要是由以下課題：測度理論、廣義線性模式、抽樣分配、模型建立、高等相依資料處理等，選取適當課題，探討目前資料分析方法、實用觀念以及可行之技巧及工具，引導學生操作或使用SPSS和SAS等分析工具。透過本課程之講授和練習，可讓學生具備對介入性研究以及護理量性資料的分析能力，進一步能夠評估研究設計及相關推論之效能，並運用於研究與實務之專業上。
The focus of this course is applied statistical techniques, with emphasis on general linear model, sampling theory, model testing, longitudinal data analysis and multivariate analysis through the Statistical Package for the Social Sciences (SPSS) and the statistical analysis system (SAS). This course will complete weekly computer assignments that provide "hands on" experience with data analysis and interpretation of results. Students will actually understand statistical procedures and apply statistical techniques to concrete data.

are expected to complete a qualitative project.

The course aims to help the student determine his/her research direction and topic, formulate research designs, and initiate or complete the writing of a research proposal.

Advanced Biostatistics
Biostatistics plays an essential role in all stages of a quantitative health care research from design through to analysis and interpretation. This course covers the essential principles and methods required for a Ph.D. degree. During this Advanced Biostatistics course, students will build on the basic statistical skills they gained in introductory statistics courses and learn to apply more advanced techniques to real data. Emphasis is on study design, appropriate analysis, software (SPSS) application and interpretation of results. The underlying concepts of statistical analysis are covered. Sessions include lectures and practical work, both computer-based and using small workshops for discussion.
Statistical analyses will be performed using SPSS and Excel. Microsoft Word is required for all written assignments (output from SPSS and Excel should be copy/pasted into Word).

Advanced Qualitative Research
此課程主要為質性研究方法論之介紹與練習，學生能了解質性研究之發展，典範 與方法論，進而能運用質性研究練習收集資料，分析資料及批判質性研究，期使 學生能有執行質性研究之專題經驗。課程內容包含：質性研究之典範，紮根理論， 現象學，各類質性研究之比較，質性研究之收集資料，分析資料，嚴謹度，批判， 撰寫等。
This course critically examines diverse qualitative approaches applied in research. The discussion emphasizes on philosophical bases of qualitative inquiries, whereas the analysis focuses on paradigmatic nature of qualitative approaches in contrast to quantitative approaches.  The class presents sampling and a variety of data collection procedures; discusses issues on rigor; explores methods of analysis appropriate to the data; and considers ethical issues associated with each stage of the research. Students are expected to complete a qualitative project.

Advanced Nursing Practicum
This course aims to provide nursing doctoral students to obtain clinical or research experiences at health related institutions. Based on familiar with clinical issues, students will analyze and interpret the current development of nursing science, involve the related practice. Concurrently, students participate in two seminars to present the progress of practicum and clinical experiences, and the theoretical and evidence based nursing care model.

Advanced Statistic Approaches and Applications in Nursing Research
隨著護理研究的現代化發展，如何根據臨床資料計算出一些有意義的數據，並利用這些數據去推論與瞭解事實，進而有助做出正確的推論與建議。本課程之目標係希冀培養學生護理量化研究之進階實務能力，進而具備現代化護理數量方法之全面觀。 課程設計將著重於數量實務模擬，針對特定主題選定適當模式完成分析，得到有效支持探討主題之結論。課程內容方面涵蓋中介變項回歸分析、交互作用分析、統合分析、多層次臨床資料分析、臨床試驗、預測與評估等多種分析技術。此外，並配合文獻標竿學習、實例個案討論報告，期使學生能夠瞭解應用方向與方式。
The focus of this course is on nursing and health related research traditions, the relationship between modern statistic paradigms and research designs and how various breakthrough statistics have been used by nurse researchers.  Advanced assumptions, developments, limitations, and advantages of modern statistic approaches in the context of clinical nursing phenomena will be addressed.
We emphasize the applications of nursing statistic methods and introduce matrices as they appear and show how they simplify the presentation of nursing research models and techniques. Statistical packages (such as SAS, SPSS) provide the numerical results to complex analysis.
全18週

Science philosophy & knowledge development
本課程旨在培養學生探索、批判、分析與建構護理知識之能力。主要學習經驗包括
區辨及探討科學哲學的演進與知識建構之型式，科學的哲理、批判理論以及探討及評值
概念的建構及理論的發展。透過相互的研討，期能使護理博士學生能從科學哲學與知識
認識層面，探討其所關注的護理議題，且應用理論或概念建構發展與實務議題有關之護
理理論或概念模式。
This course aims to provide students with the skills to investigate, assess, and analyze
nursing knowledge. The learning experience involves the exploration of the development of
science philosophy and of nursing knowledge. The course is a research and discussion
experience aimed at enabling doctoral graduate students to become knowledgeable about
approaches to studies of scientific knowledge development. Forces affecting the development
of knowledge, the origins of key terms and concepts, and the identification of nursing issues related to epistemology and the philosophy of science identification will also be explored.

Advanced Quantitative Research
本課程為進階量性研究方法論；課程在探討實證護理應用於實務及不同的研究設計方
法之特性及優缺點，並進一步介紹各個研究步驟之重點及相關議題。學生將依指引檢驗與
批判已發表於專業期刊當中之研究文獻，學習發表研究報告之重點；以期未來能以此知識
為基礎，完成完善的量性研究計畫。
The course of the advanced quantitative research methods addresses theoretical basis of
advanced quantitative methods. Focus of the course is placed on the importance of nursing research in evidence-based practice. Various research designs, research steps and related issues will be thoroughly discussed. Based on the guidance, students are required to critique papers published in well-known journals. After completion of the class, students will learn to appreciate a research paper, report the research findings, and develop their research plan in the near future.

01
Doctoral  Seminar  in  Nursing  Science
本博士班專論課程旨在深入的探討護理實務與研究之議題。應用護理措
施以減輕個案因健康問題在生理、心理、社會、靈性上產生的負擔，以增進
護理實務和個案生活品質。教授和學生探討當代實務、教育和研究議題，探
索理論背景並考慮如何適當的科學研究。學生選擇議題，如疾病預防措施、
症狀管理處置、生理/心理/認知失調護理等，進行研究相關之瞭解。本課程之
另一目的是引領學生進入學術領域，如學術寫作、作者與發表倫理、學術報
告與發表、研究倫理、研究對象等。學生將選擇有興趣之議題作深入探討與
批判並撰寫成學術文章。
This doctoral seminar will provide an overview of science and research in 
nursing practice. Topics will include the patterns of human responses to illness (e.g., 
physical, functional, cognitive, psychosocial, and spiritual). In  particular, nursing 
interventions will be examined for their ability to reduce illness burden, improve care 
delivery, and enhance quality of life. Faculty and students will discuss current 
research agendas in nursing and related fields; and explore the competing theoretical 
perspectives in a substantive research area and consider how each would guide an 
empirical study. The student will select a mentor for research experiences on an issue 
topic such as prevention, symptom management, physical/mental disability and 
function, sleep and related nursing interventions. In addition, this doctoral seminar 
aims to prepare the student for scholarship careers in nursing,  including topics for 
discussion such as scientific writing, authorship and publication issues, oral 
presentation of research results, research ethics, human subject issues, and mentored 
research experiences. The student writes a synthesis of research literature, including a critical review of research in area of dissertation interest in a manuscript format to be 
submitted for publication.
全18週

本課程旨在增進學生對相關測量理論及健康醫護研究測量議題的了解，且能提昇其測量工具品質檢測、使用與發展的知能。主要的課程內容包含測量理論、健康醫護研究各領域中常見的測量技巧及其議題、測量工具的發展、測量工具品質的檢定、測量工具的翻譯與國際運用等。學生經由課題的講解、各類測量及工具的查證、批判與討論、測量工具發展的應用等活動，以增進其研究測量的能力。

measurement process, current measurement and measures of frequently used in health-related inquiry, 
and to promote their ability in applying principles of instrument development to current measurement 
problem. Course contents include theories of measurement, psychometric quality of research 
instruments, strategies for designing measures, measurement issues in health-related inquiry, and 
application of principles of instruments development in research study.

Applied Multivariate Quantitative Methods

Environment and Health Policy
本課程在提供學生對環境與健康政策的整體觀，從預防保健的角度分析國內及國際的環境與健康政策議題，並重新定位健康與環境政策原則。學生可針對各國健康政策的推動、健康服務品質的保障、國內外政府與非政府之健康組織與資源的整合與運用等議題進行分析與討論，針對上述健康政策議題提出需求評估、計畫評值或成果評價。

Students critique and debate a variety of health care reforms to enhance quality, assure access, and improve cost efficiency. The application of nursing research in outcome studies, program evaluation, and needs assessment is explored.

The learning experience involves the exploration of the development of science philosophy and of nursing knowledge. The course is a research and discussion experience aimed at enabling doctoral graduate students to become knowledgeable about approaches to studies of scientific knowledge development. Forces affecting the development of knowledge, the origins of key terms and concepts, and the identification of nursing issues related to epistemology and the philosophy of science identification will also be explored.

This course will complete weekly computer assignments that provide "hands on" experience with data analysis and interpretation of results. Students will actually understand statistical procedures and apply statistical techniques to concrete data.

Topics will include commonly used designs, methods for randomization, blinding and sample size determination, choice of controls, collaborative/ multicenter trial requirements and operational issues, data management and data quality issues, interim analysis methods, critical review of clinical trial results, ethics considerations and statistical techniques for analyzing clinical trial and nursing intervention data.

Dissertation Independent Study I
本課程以個別指導之形式，依據博士生未來護理專業發展方向，引導學生探索護理實務相關之研究議題，進行相關理論及照護模式之分析，結合其臨床專業技能，應用批判性思考及實證護理的概念，與產官學界等多方領域先進之討論，訂定研究方向及主題，擬定研究設計、進行或完成研究計畫之撰寫。
This course is conducted through individualized instruction and is designed to guide doctoral students in exploring research topics relevant to their future nursing professional development. It involves the analysis of pertinent theories and care models, integration of their clinical expertise, application of critical thinking and evidence-based nursing concepts, and engagement in discussions with experts from various sectors including academia, industry, and government. The course aims to help the student determine his/her research direction and topic, formulate research designs, and initiate or complete the writing of a research proposal.
